description: Erection of a two storey detached house and associated works following partial demolition of the existing house
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (01 rev A, 02 rev A, 03 rev A, 04 rev B, 10 rev A, 11 rev A, 12 rev A, 13 rev A,  and Design and Access Statement rev b 081117jr dated 08 November 2017 received on 08/11/2017. 09 rev D received on 19/12/2017) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall be as specified in the application documents.

Condition : 4 - The development shall not be occupied until the existing vehicular crossover from Cromwell Road is closed and reinstated to footway so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 5 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the  side walls of the dwelling hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the occupation 0of the dwelling hereby approved a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority   The boundary treatment shall be completed before before the dwelling is occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 8 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 9 - Notwithstanding the submitted plans full details of the proposed cycle stores for both houses shall be submitted and approved prior to the first beneficial occupation of the dwelling hereby approved and this shall be so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 10 - Notwithstanding the submitted plans full details of the proposed refuse stores for both houses shall be submitted and approved prior to the first beneficial occupation of the dwelling hereby approved and this shall be so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 11 - Prior to commencement of development the final detailed drainage designs and associated full drainage maintenance plan shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved details to limit surface water runoff from the site to 5 l/s.

Condition : 12 - The development shall be constructed to achieve the recommended internal noise levels as specified in Table 5.1 of British Standard BS8233:2014. 
Prior to the occupation of development post completion noise tests shall be carried out by accredited/approved organisations in order to demonstrate that this has been achieved. Noise tests shall be carried out taking account of worst case environmental conditions, such as easterly operations at Heathrow, peak time traffic flows wind speed, direction and presence of temperature inversion. Continuous logged data shall be submitted, together with parameters measuring LAeq, 16 hours during day-time (07:00 - 23:00) and Bedroom = 30 dB LAeq, 8 hours during night-time (23:00 - 07:00), LA90 for day and night and LAFmax at 1m from external fa?ade.

Condition : 13 - Prior to commencement of development, a detailed energy statement shall be submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The Energy statement shall include the following:
I.	detail how the development will follow the hierarchy of energy efficiency, decentralised energy and renewable energy technologies set out in the London Plan,
II.	detail how the development will aim for, and secure, a 35% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions against a Building Regulations Part L (2013) compliant baseline.
III.	ensure a maximum internal water consumption rate of 105 litres/per person/per day (with an additional maximum external water allowance rate of 5 litres).
In addition the statement shall detail how the development will meet the following standards in relation to materials:
- At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
- At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
- No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
It is also encouraged to assess the development under the Home Quality Mark.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
